intro: Cyanea grimesiana var. obatae, commonly known as the Obatae's Cyanea, is a rare endemic plant species native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and is often found in moist, shaded environments on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
